title: Take-Out
text: I ordered the small meat burroti wrap with butter chicken and 2 piece samosa as a side. Overall the wrap was very flavourful and tasted very good. The wrap portion is actually regular in size even though it lists as “small.”

title: Take-Out Order
text: I ordered the shish tawook plate which came with rice, salad, hummus, potatoes and pita. Overall, the chicken tasted very fresh and moist. The meal was very filling.

title: Take-Out Order
text: I ordered the chicken souvlaki on a pita and side salad. Overall, the chicken and salad had a good amount of flavour. Although, the price for the meal was a little high.

title: Re-Opening of the New “Peppers Bar”
text: The old Peppers Bar has been bought out by new owners. The Bar name still remains the same, although their food menu has changed.

title: Take-Out Meal
text: I tried the chicken souvlaki on a pita and the Greek fries for take-out. Overall both tasted very good, although the fries were a little soggy.

title: Take-out
text: I ordered for the 5 Nashville strippers(chicken strips) and crinkle cut fries for take-out. The chicken strips came in a bigger than expected portion, they are a lot larger in size compared to your typical chicken strips your used to. I was very full and couldn’t finish all 5 pieces. The fries had good seasoning to them as well. Overall, the chicken and fries tasted very good.

title: Returning Customer - Very good food
text: I have ordered food from here many times. I ordered for take-out. I ordered the chicken shawarma on a pita and large fattoush salad. As well as the beef and chicken shawarma plates with a small fattoush salad for my parents. We all enjoyed our meals very much. They serve large portions and the items are decently priced. I typically don’t order chicken shawarma because of the taste, but the shawarma they serve here tastes very good, clean and fresh compared to the other places you buy shawarma from. This is the only place I would buy chicken shawarma from. I would recommend trying the chicken shawarma and fattoush salad if you already haven’t.

title: Good Food for Take Out
text: I have ordered twice from here, both times I ordered the dinner wrap combo which comes with a gyro on a pita, fries, salad and pop. The first time I order with the chicken(gyro style with cut up meat) and the second time I ordered with the chicken souvlaki on a stick. I preferred it better with the souvlaki and I found it tasted better. The fries they have are very good as they add a hint of spice to the fries. Salad was good, but could use more flavour in the dressing. My husband also ordered the gyro(beef) dinner which came with rice, potatoes and salad. He enjoyed his meal as well. I will most likely be ordering from here again.

title: Permanently Closed
text: This establishment has closed its doors after an impressive 42 total years as a known brand in the city. Although a new Greek restaurant has now taken its place at the same location.

title: Very Good Food
text:
I had made a reservation for a group of 6 (3 couples). The establishment interior is smaller compared to typical restaurants. To start we ordered the calamari and breaded shrimp, both tasted average.

For the main course we ordered the steak Josephine, filet mignon, Cuban lobster, surf and turf, and peppercorn chicken. Our meals also came with a salad, potatoes and greens. The sides you receive are very huge portions (try not to fill up on appetizers for this reason). The caeser salad was very delicious! Everyone also enjoyed their main course very much. Although my peppercorn chicken tasted good but it was very spicy - too spicy to eat. We also ordered dessert which tasted good as well.

We all ordered 1-2 drinks each which cost cost us under $200 per 2 people.

title: Take Out
text: I ordered the chicken burrito to go. Overall, the burrito had great flavour and tasted good. The burrito is very clean to eat compared to regular wraps which the sauce,veggies and meat drips down at the bottom. Also, the rice inside the burrito is nicely seasoned rather than having plain rice.

title: Take Out
text: I ordered the joojeh breast and soltani meals to go. Overall, the meals tasted very good and comes in good portioned size.

title: Outdoor Patio Lunch
text:
First time coming to this establishment. I came for lunch and we were seated outside on the patio. The view is quite extraordinary, located right on the water. It happened to be a bit breezy the day we came, so I would suggest to bring a jacket if you are planning to sit on the patio.

To start I had the fried calamari, I then ordered from the Prefixe lunch menu which comes with 3 courses total (app, main course and dessert). I ordered the caesar salad, Chicken Piccata, and New York Cheesecake. Everything tasted very good. My family members ordered the Filet Mignon, Salmon and scallop risotto. They all enjoyed their meals as well. I would recommend to dine here for a special occasion, as the food is more on the pricey side. Also, I noticed that our waiter was not wearing a mask while serving us on the patio, although I did not mention anything.

title: Excellent for Walking
text: Bayfront is a great place to come with friends, couples or family. The scenery is very soothing and appealing to view because it is surrounded by water. I usually come here for exercise in the spring and summer time. It has long paved trails for you to take a walk or jog around. In the summer it also has food trucks. There are washrooms located at this park and a large parking lot to park your car free of charge. I recommend this park for people who live in Hamilton and for people who live out of town and want a change of scenery.

title: Take-out Meal
text: I ordered the Tandoori shawarma wrap and banana/Nutella crepe as dessert. Overall, the tandoori chicken wrap was very flavourful. The Banana and Nutella crepe was good as well.

title: So Fun!
text: Everytime I come to Clifton hills, I always walked by this mini put and have always wanted to play here, because it just looks so fun with all the dinosaurs. Today, I finally got the chance to go mini putting at the Dinosaur Adventure Golf! I must say, my friends and I very much enjoyed ourselves! This mini put course has such a great atmosphere and very enjoyable scenery because of all the dinosaurs around! and an “erupting” Volcano of fire! Very cool! The price is also very reasonable and not too expensive! I would definitely recommend this to family’s with children, a group of friends whether you are a teenager or older, and couples. Fun for everyone. I would definitely come back and play.

title: Sunday Brunch
text: Came here during the weekend. It was extremely busy, so at first we had to wait outside(because of COVID) for a table to open up inside. Wait was around 20 mins for a group of 4. We were seated at a booth. I ordered the build your own grand slam which consists of 4 items of your choice. My friends ordered, the All American Slam, double berry banana pancake breakfast , and choconana pancake breakfast. We all enjoyed our meals. My friends mentioned that the pancakes were delicious. We were seated close to the restrooms, and I noticed a lot of people were walking to the restroom with no mask on, especially the ones coming from the outdoor patio. I believe this location should become more strict when it comes to the COVID rules and the safety of others.

title: Weekend Dinner
text: It was my first time eating at this establishment. I came with a group of friends. We were seated on the outdoor patio and we booked a reservation in advance. I would recommend to book your reservation ahead of time for the weekend, because the restaurant does get book up pretty quickly. As an appetizer, we had the calamari. It was very tasty but a little spicy because of the piri piri sauce and jalapeño peppers. For my main course, I had the grilled Zucchini flatbread which was a vegan dish. My friends had the pasta and poutine. Overall, we enjoyed the restaurant ambience and the food. The staff working there, were very courteous. While dining there, they made sure we were well taken care of (The *most* courteous worker there, was a man with glasses, unfortunately I didn’t get his name, perhaps he was the manager?).

title: Outdoor Patio
text: Came for dinner and we were seated on the outdoor patio. The patio provides nice privacy with their greenery while being located next to the mall parking lot. We ordered the calamari to start. As mains, I ordered the Cajun chicken caesar salad, and my husband ordered the bigger better burger. Overall, we both enjoyed our meals. Earls is my go-to when it comes to Cajun chicken, hands down the best.

title: Great View While Dining
text: It was my first time coming to this establishment during the weekend. The restaurant is located right on the water which makes it a great place to eat and drink while enjoying the view. I came with 4 other family members. I would recommend making reservations prior coming, because it was very packed when we arrived and no seating was available for people who did not reserve ahead of time. There is seating for both the patio and indoors at the moment, during COVID. As an appetizer we ordered the calamari which tasted very good and fresh. As a main course, I ended up ordering the Margarita Pizza, and caeser salad. My other family members ordered the sushi bowl, fish and chips, boa burger and steak frites. Overall, everyone enjoyed their meal. I would say my meal tasted average although it was worth to come for the view.

title: Outdoor Patio Dinner
text: Came to this location during COVID. Jack Astor’s is doing a great job with being pre cautious for social distancing. We chose to sit outside on their patio. At each table they have place markers that indicate which tables can be used or not used for seating, to maintain a safe distance between people. I ended up ordering the dry seasoning chicken fingers with caeser salad as a side. My husband ordered the Memphis sirloin which came with vegetables and a baked potato. Overall, we both enjoy our meals very much. Both meals tasted great. We also enjoyed the music they played outside while dining there as well.

title: Amazing
text: First time trying this restaurant with my husband. We sat outdoors. I ordered the chicken souvlaki on a pita and my husband ordered the lamb souvlaki. The chicken souvlaki on a pita was very tender and had good flavour, the fries tasted good as well. My husband enjoyed his lamb very much and mentioned it tasted amazing and was one of the best souvlaki he’s ever had. We also had excellent service from our waiter he was very courteous and I would recommend coming here if you have never been to this restaurant before.

title: Real Chicken
text: First time trying Mary Browns, I was quite surprised as a fast food restaurant that the chicken actually tasted real and not preserved. I ordered the chicken tender combo which came with wedge fries and my husband ordered the spicy Mary’s burger combo. The chicken tenders had good flavour and were real chicken cutlets. The spicy burger was actually very spicy, that it took my husband much longer to finish because it was in fact that spicy. The wedge fries also had good flavour. Overall the food was very good, I will be back to order again in the near future.

title: Excellent
text: First time eating here with my husband. We came here for lunch. I ordered the lunch entree which came with chicken souvlaki, salad, potatoes, and rice. Overall, everything tasted amazing, the chicken, salad and lemon potatoes had an excellent amount of flavour, I was very impressed. My husband had the gyro on a pita with fries. Overall, we both enjoyed our meals very much.

title: Very Large Portioned Wraps
text: I purchased a chicken souvlaki on a pita with salad as a side, it came with a drink as a combo. I was surprised by the large portion of the pita wrap, the chicken is also nicely marinated. Overall, I enjoyed my chicken pita, it tasted very good although the salad could have used more dressing. I also thought the price for the combo was a little expensive. I will most likely return again.

title: Best Tasting Samosa’s Ever
text: I have had their samosas many times. My favourite is their vegetarian samosa, hands down the most delicious samosa I have ever tasted in my life. They have cheese, and meat samosas as well. The samosas come with a spicy sauce on the side as well, to dip in your samosa for extra flavour. They also have many sweets, cakes, dry fruits as well as an Indian cuisine take out menu. They also do catering as their establishment states “A-One Catering.”

title: New Location
text: Newly opened location. I have purchased two fudge flavours: butter finger and salted caramel dark chocolate, both flavours tasted amazing. The store is clean, organized and following COVID rules. The Staff are really friendly and welcoming. Overall, great selection of chocolates.

title: Versatile Park
text: This park has a nice circular trail for walking or jogging, that also leads down into Rushdale park that consists of a playground and basketball court. It is like having two parks in one almost. TB McQueston also has a soccer field, playground and parking lot. Overall, I enjoy this park.

title: BBQ Chicken Sandwich
text: Overall I would my rating 3.5/5 because, I am only rating based on my one take-out meal I ordered from this location. I ended up ordering the BBQ chicken sandwich, which came with a side of fries. I have tried this sandwich at a different location and thought, if I ordered the same at this location it would taste similar, but I was wrong, it just tasted average to me although it was made from a real chicken breast which is a plus. I believe if I go back to this establishment and order a different item off their menu, I will probably have a better food experience.

title: Take-out
text: I ordered an XL pizza with 3 toppings, as well as a shawarma dinner for take-out. Overall, I enjoyed the shawarma dinner but I found the pizza to just taste average.

title: Pizza
text: I have had pizza from here twice (take-out). Overall pizza tastes average/good. They are very generous with their toppings though especially for meat.

title: Take-out
text: I placed an order for take out last week. I ordered the whole chicken dinner with potatoes and salad. I ordered my piri sauce on the side. Overall I really enjoyed the chicken, it tasted very good and fresh. The potatoes were good although the flavour is light and the salad average.

title: Group of 12
text: This was my first time axe throwing. We arrived as a group 12 people. As an introduction, we had an amazing coach named Matt. He was great at instructing the rules of the game as well as teaching each person how to properly throw an axe. I would definitely recommend a coach if it is your first time axe throwing. As a brief summary - to start, the game is 1 vs. 1 (two teams) depending on how big your party is. We had two lanes in total. Each person takes their turn throwing an axe, amongst your team. Your objective is to hit the axe, as close to a bullseye as possible to gather more points to beat the other team. The top 4 players with the most points have a face off, from there the top two players move on to the final round. Then, the top two players have a “big axe” battle for top player. Overall, I would most likely try this again although I find it could be a little on the pricey side for the total amount of time you get to play as a larger party. If more lanes were open for us, it would have been more enjoyable.
place: BATL | The Backyard Axe Throwing League

title: Weekend Dinner Party
text: It is my second time coming here. We arrived as a party of 10 people. I ordered the quarter chicken with fries - mild sauce. My husband ordered the brisket sandwich wrapped up with a side of potatoes. After trying the potatoes and fries as sides. I would recommend the fries over the potatoes. If the potatoes had a little more flavour, I think they would have beat the fries. Overall the food tasted good and fresh. The only downside was, the location of where we were seated, was very close to the cash area where the food was being grilled. Therefore, we smelt like chicken afterwards when we left because I don’t think they have proper ventilation in the space.

title: Take-out Dinner
text: Tried this place for the first time, this past week. I ordered the shish tawook(chicken kebab) wrap and falafel wrap to-go. As I was in the store waiting to pick up my order, the man behind the counter preparing everyone's food seemed to be working very hard and fast paced trying to get everyone's order ready, which showed he is a very hard worker. Overall, once I tried the chicken wrap, the meat tasted very fresh and had good flavor to it. The pricing is very decent as well. Next time I go, I will try the chicken shawarma - it looked very good, as I saw the employee preparing someone else's order in the restaurant, while waiting to pick-up my own order.

title: Tried the Burrito and Burrito Bowl
text:
I ordered a large chicken burrito and beef burrito bowl this past weekend to-go.
I tried the chicken burrito and my husband tried the beef burrito bowl. Overall, we felt very healthy eating our meals because the ingredients tasted so fresh. Although, I found that the chicken had no flavour nor seasoning which would give my rating an overall 3/5 of just average. My husband on the other hand very much enjoyed his meal which was the beef burrito bowl.

title: Chicken for Lunch
text: I came here for lunch with a co-worker, both our first time eating here. We both ordered the 1/4 chicken dinner which came with fries and salad. Overall, the chicken tasted moist but was lacking flavour, just tasted average to me. The fries tasted good, the salad sauce didn’t have much flavour to me either. The interior of the space was nicely designed and had a cozy atmosphere. My rating would be 3.5 if you could give .5 ratings.

title: Permanently Closed
text:
My first experience eating at this establishment, I ordered the chicken souvlaki main to-go, which came with two skewers of chicken, salad and rice. Overall the portion was good, although one of the meat skewers didn’t taste fresh, as if it was pre grilled a day or two before. Ever since then, I never returned.

Also, I believe that Peppers has permanently closed recently. No longer operational.

title: Weekend Lunch
text: I have always been a fan of Earl’s. I have been to this location a few times in the past. I recently came again on the weekend, and noticed that they have done a miniature renovation within the restaurant involving new seating , furniture and lighting. I ended up ordering an appetizer to start which was the white truffle garlic bread, you could really smell the truffle once the waitress served it to us, it also had great flavour. For my main course I ordered the caeser salad with Cajun chicken. Overall my meal tasted excellent. I will definitely be returning to this establishment.

title: Burrito-to-Go
text: Came here to grab a burrito to go. This was my first time ordering at Fat Bastard in general. There were three different sizes of burrito sizes to choose from - Lil, Big, And Huge. I ended up ordering the Big size, “Jerk Chicken” flavoured Burrito. When ordering and choosing ingredients, it was unique how the ingredients also include instant noodles(optional) along with rice as an option. Overall my burrito was very filling and tasted very flavourful.

title: Dinner on the Bar side of Jack’s
text: Usually I choose to be seated in the dining area but this time , my husband and I chose to be seated in the bar area. We ordered a few drinks and then proceeded to order. I ordered the chicken fingers with caeser salad and I also ordered a side of the parmesan truffle fries which seemed to be new to their menu. My husband ordered a steak with mashed potatoes. Overall I enjoyed my meal, the chicken fingers tasted fresh and I really liked their truffle fries, you could really taste the truffle flavour. Our waiter Dave, was also very accommodating and provided very great service which made our meal and experience more enjoyable at Jack Astor’s.

title: Lunch
text: First time trying this place. Not many items listed on their menu. I ordered the chicken burger(aka the Valentino) and thin cut fries. Overall the chicken burger tasted delicious, I was not expecting it to taste as good as it tasted! Don’t be fooled by the interior. Food is decently priced as well.

title: First visit at this location
text: Upon entering, the atmosphere seemed very warm and cozy. I came with a larger group, about 10 people. We started off by ordering drinks, when I received my drink and tasted it, it was not the correct drink I ordered, my drink seemed to be mixed up with someone else’s (similar in colour). We then ordered our food, I had ordered a caeser salad with the blackened chicken, I specifically mentioned no bacon in my salad, the waitress noted it down and had acknowledged this. When I received my salad, it ended up having bacon in it. I would have rated this restaurant much higher if they had not kept messing up my orders because I thought the food was quite good.

title: Quiet Dinner
text: I ended up ordering the Margareta++ pizza. Overall pizza tasted very good. Pizza was very thin, with a thick soft crust. There is also a “spicy oil” you can add onto your pizza, this oil is very good to dip your pizza crust into. It is mainly olive oil with a tinge of spice to it(mild spice).

title: Authentic Poutine
text: I am from out of town and wanted to experience an authentic tasting poutine in Quebec. I came for lunch. Upon reviewing the menu, there is an optional sheet given to you, to fill out if you wanted to create a custom poutine with the ingredients of your choice. I ended up ordering a menu item called poutineville (without the beef). This poutine was very unique compared to other poutines I have had, because instead of fries you receive mashed potatoes with your traditional gravy and cheese of course. Their house wine gravy had a nice flavour. Overall poutine tasted good and very cheesy.

title: Shawarma for Lunch
text: The food is decently priced. I had the chicken shawarma, overall it was filling and tasted very good.

title: Coffee, Tea & more
text: Myself and my family ordered a few things from Coffee Fellows. I tried their Banana Cha Cha frappito which tasted amazing, we also had some baked goods, coffee and tea which all tasted good as well.

title: Very good
text: My co-workers had ordered numerous pizzas for lunch, it was my first time trying Maker Pizza. I tried the Margherita pizza, and even though it was plain with little toppings it was the most amazing pizza I ever tasted packed with flavour. I will definitely be placing future orders from today.

title: Brunch
text: Haven’t been to Golden Griddle in a few years but decided to come in for a brunch. I ended up ordering a breakfast meal, food tasted good but the portions I received were very small and not filling. I had bacon strips, home fries, toast and a fruit cup. Home fries portion was very small, was still hungry afterwards.

title: Reservation for Large Group
text: First time being at this location, came for lunch with my co-workers. We grabbed many share platters(appetizers). I ended up trying the hummus and calamari apps which both tasted really good. As a main, I had the rotisserie chicken which ended up being half a chicken! It came with mashed potatoes and vegetables. The chicken was nicely seasoned and tasted very moist, overall the food tasted great. I most likely will return. Although, I find the pricing is a little high.

title: Fast food style
text: Ordered multiple chicken shawarma wraps and shawarma plates. Overall food tasted good, portion was filling and reasonably priced. Although, only one option of meat - chicken shawarma.

title: Party of 12
text:
Booked a reservation for a party of 12. All our first time eating at this establishment. We ordered a multiple of the Lebanese Cavapi, Lunch in Beirut, Before Sunset, with sides of friend cauliflower, halloumi cheese, and Persian tea as a beverage. Overall everything tasted amazing. The price per plate is expensive but worth it for the big portion amount you receive. The fried cauliflower is a must to try, very delicious. Customer service was very good, especially if the staff is aware it is your first time eating there.

They currently don’t have their liquor license but are obtaining it shortly in November. The interior is a smaller scale restaurant but our waiter mentioned they are expanding the size to a larger place next door to them (or combining the two spaces).

title: Dinner
text: Came here with a group of four. We ordered a vegetable soup, steak dish, chicken dish and chicken pizza. Popcorn is complimentary appetizer. Overall, everyone enjoyed their meal and thought it tasted great but for myself I would give this restaurant a 3/5 because the chicken tasted average. Also, the prices are expensive. A coke bottle is about 6-8 euros each.

title: Very good food
text: I came here with a group of four. We ordered the joujeh boneless kebab, soltani, vaziri, and mast o khiar. Overall food tasted amazing. Meals were quite pricey. Our waitress was very friendly and courteous.

title: Amazing
text: I booked a guided tour in advance and I would recommend the same. Make sure to book for the by pass line summit access, which takes you to the second level as well as the top level after the tour. There are four elevators in total which fit up to about 45 people. On the second level, there is a cafe and souvenir shop. On the very top level there is a champagne bar, as well as wax figurines of the Eiffel Tower architect, Thomas Edison and another lady. Overall, the view is amazing from the second floor but on the top floor the view is even better.

title: Good
text: Overall food tasted good. Make sure to keep your receipt if you would like to use the washroom, you have to punch in your order code to access the washroom. Ordered my food later in the night, cashiers, weren’t very accommodating, they could see costumers such as myself in line but wouldn’t bother taking your order unless you said something to them.

title: 3 Night stay
text: A small scale hotel, surrounded by many cafes, and restaurants about 5-10mins walking distance. The main floor lobby is very modernly designed. There is an option of buffet breakfast although this wasn’t included with my stay. The room was kept very clean each day. Free Nespresso coffee was provided in your room, as well as a free bottle of water per day. Staff was very friendly and courteous. You are required to pay a small city taxes fee per night. We stayed in a superior room and standard room, I would recommend a luxury room for more space.

title: Avoid this place
text: I ended up ordering the chicken caeser salad and my husband ordered the steak and fries. Before my meal was prepared I asked for my chicken to be well done, which the waiter mentioned the chicken is always well done. When I received my order, my chicken was very cold and not well done. It felt like the chicken was not prepared fresh but have been kept refrigerated(not sure if that’s normal in France for chicken to served cold in a salad). My husband on the other hand had no issues and enjoyed his food. The restaurant pricing is also expensive because of the location. At the end of our meal when we had to pay our waiter gave us our bill then brought a calculator to us and typed in an amount for his service taxes, and mentioned that his amount was for his tip. After we payed we felt scammed, other restaurants do not do this.
